result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brianna R J Hardy was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*111 days sentence credit. 
*Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but not until after serving 18 months.
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not until after serving 18 months.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Waukesha County Case #20CM2042
Consecutive to Marathon County Case #22CF555
BUT Concurrent with Marathon County Case #22CF556

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $600 plus costs.
*Pay DNA Surcharge.
*Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Drivers License Revocation will be left up to the Department.
*Provide DNA Sample.
*Remain absolutely sober.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna R J Hardy

records.addlTxt:
Corrected the Waukesha County Case #20CM2042 (incorrectly listed as 20CM2040)
and
Concurrent with Marathon County Case #22CF556 (incorrectly listed as consecutive)
sent to DOC Interface on 09/28/22 sp
Plea/Sentencing and Motion Hearing set for 06/08/22 - undeliverable as addressed
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on June 8, 2022
filed by Atty William Weiland
filed by Atty William Weiland

Count 1:  Prison with Extended Supervision 
Count 2:  Dismissed

Defendant Brianna R J Hardy in court, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Brianna R J Hardy.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

3:01 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.
There is an agreement.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed.
Court reviews the charging language in the complaint.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

There was a bond modification motion, may be rendered moot.
Court will not address this motion at this time due to the fact of today's hearing.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Court addresses prior convictions.
Defendant concurs there are prior convictions.


BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1: OWI 6th offense. 346.63(1)(a)
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
Count 2: Dismissed.

Atty Dodge makes sentencing arguments to the court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court addresses the parties, if there is any question, or if this is done incorrectly, the Department of Corrections will provide guidance as to what the drivers license revocation should be.
343.31(1m)(b) states that the revocation is left up to the department.

Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Court questions Defendant.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 48 months.
Initial Confinement for 24 months.
Extended Supervision for 24 months.
111 days sentence credit. 
Consecutive to Waukesha County Case 20CM-2040.
Consecutive to Marathon County Case 22CF-555.
Concurrent to Marathon County Case 22CF-556.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program until after serving 18 months.
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program until after serving 18 months.
Conditions:
Drivers License Revocation will be left up to the Department.
Ignition Interlock Device for 48 months.
Pay a fine of $600 plus costs.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
AODA Assessment and comply recommendations.
Remain absolutely sober.
Do not operate a motor vehicle. 
Obtain and maintain full time employment or education of both to equal full time.
Motion hearing on June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 04/11/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Order to Transport /s/ PB 04/28/22
Order to Transport filed by the State (sent to Br 3 Judge on 04/27/22 sp)
Matter set for a P/S on 5/10/2022 at 11:30 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 05/16/2022 at 9:30 a.m. - Offer was given, defense needs to speak with client about offer
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification filed by Atty William Weiland (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 04/07/22 sp)
Letter from the Defendant dated 03/22/22 in re:  request for motion to reduce bond, correct the charge and for new counsel (not sent to Judge as the defendant is represented sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:36 PM Defendant Brianna R J Hardy appeared by video, in custody Waupaca County Jail. Attorney William George Weiland appeared in court for Brianna R J Hardy, Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty William Weiland
Preliminary Hearing set for 03/07/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Filed by Prosecutor.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:50 PM Attorney (Atty) William George Weiland in court for Defendant Brianna R J Hardy. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brianna R J Hardy appeared by video from jail.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.
Atty Weiland states that they have recieved a copy of the complaint and waives reading.
Atty Weiland requests a preliminary hearing and that time limits are waived.
Defendant concurs.

BY THE COURT:
Time limits waived.

Atty Weiland makes statements regarding an alteration of bond.
Atty Cassidy makes statements against modifying the current bond.
Court questions Atty Cassidy.

BY THE COURT:
Request for modification of bond is denied.

Preliminary Hearing to be set on March 7th, 2022 at 3 PM in Branch 1.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:09 PM  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brianna R J Hardy appeared by video, in custody, from Portage County Jail. 

Court calls case.
Att Pfeil states appearances.

Atty Soule is present but does not represent Defendant, is not sure if this Defendant is eligible for representation.

Court questions Defendant regarding representation. 

Defendant states she is eligible for state public defender representation.
Defendant has not been assigned one yet.

Court questions Defendant further.
Initial appearance was supposed to be yesterday but adjourned to today.
Defendant has the criminal complaint.

Court informs Defendant of charges.

Court will adjourn the hearing to allow Defendant to continue to work toward an attorney.

Defendant wants a signature bond or a bond reduction.

Court will set matter for a review hearing on Friday.
Court replies as to the request for bond modification.

BY THE COURT:
Bond will be continued.
  Review hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant incarcerated. Warrant not to be processed.
Body Only

10:11 AM Defendant Brianna R J Hardy not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Defendant not in court.
State requests cash be forfeited and body only warrant.

BY THE COURT: Body only warrant is granted. Cash bond is forfeited.

(CCAP shows bond not paid, nothing can be forfeited)

Court believes defendant may be in jail.
Court advises Atty Mutchler about defendant.
Initial Appearance set for January 31, 2022 @ 9:00 am in Br 3
Citation for Operating with PAC (3rd)

Remain absolutely sober from alcohol.   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment.   Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty)  Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

1:13 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

This is a riverside hearing.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 6th offense and PAC 6th offense. 
PBT: .14
Defendant is eligible for representation from the public defender's office.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule addresses the Court regarding bond, requests signature bond or a lower cash bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: January 31, 2022   @ 9:00 am  in Branch 3.
